info.description:
AWS IoT

AWS IoT provides secure, bi-directional communication between Internet-connected things (such as sensors, actuators, embedded devices, or smart appliances) and the AWS cloud. You can discover your custom IoT-Data endpoint to communicate with, configure rules for data processing and integration with other services, organize resources associated with each thing (Thing Registry), configure logging, and create and manage policies and credentials to authenticate things.

For more information about how AWS IoT works, see the Developer Guide.
info.title: AWS IoT

patch.description:
Accepts a pending certificate transfer. The default state of the certificate is INACTIVE.

To check for pending certificate transfers, call ListCertificates to enumerate your certificates.

post.description: Lists the policies attached to the specified thing group.

get.description: Describes an authorizer.

post.description: Creates an authorizer.
Invoke the specified custom authorizer for testing purposes.

get.description: Lists the authorizers registered in your account.

post.description: Registers a CA certificate with AWS IoT. This CA certificate can then be used to sign device certificates, which can be then registered with AWS IoT. You can register up to 10 CA certificates per AWS account that have the same subject field. This enables you to have up to 10 certificate authorities sign your device certificates. If you have more than one CA certificate registered, make sure you pass the CA certificate when you register your device certificates with the RegisterCertificate API.

get.description: Describes a registered CA certificate.

Lists the CA certificates registered for your AWS account.

The results are paginated with a default page size of 25. You can use the returned marker to retrieve additional results.

patch.description:
Cancels a pending transfer for the specified certificate.

Note Only the transfer source account can use this operation to cancel a transfer. (Transfer destinations can use RejectCertificateTransfer instead.) After transfer, AWS IoT returns the certificate to the source account in the INACTIVE state. After the destination account has accepted the transfer, the transfer cannot be cancelled.

After a certificate transfer is cancelled, the status of the certificate changes from PENDING_TRANSFER to INACTIVE.

post.description: Registers a device certificate with AWS IoT. If you have more than one CA certificate that has the same subject field, you must specify the CA certificate that was used to sign the device certificate being registered.

get.description:
Lists the certificates registered in your AWS account.

The results are paginated with a default page size of 25. You can use the returned marker to retrieve additional results.

post.description:
Creates an X.509 certificate using the specified certificate signing request.

Note: The CSR must include a public key that is either an RSA key with a length of at least 2048 bits or an ECC key from NIST P-256 or NIST P-384 curves.

Note: Reusing the same certificate signing request (CSR) results in a distinct certificate.

You can create multiple certificates in a batch by creating a directory, copying multiple .csr files into that directory, and then specifying that directory on the command line. The following commands show how to create a batch of certificates given a batch of CSRs.

Assuming a set of CSRs are located inside of the directory my-csr-directory:

On Linux and OS X, the command is:

$ ls my-csr-directory/ | xargs -I {} aws iot create-certificate-from-csr --certificate-signing-request file://my-csr-directory/{}

This command lists all of the CSRs in my-csr-directory and pipes each CSR file name to the aws iot create-certificate-from-csr AWS CLI command to create a certificate for the corresponding CSR.

The aws iot create-certificate-from-csr part of the command can also be run in parallel to speed up the certificate creation process:

$ ls my-csr-directory/ | xargs -P 10 -I {} aws iot create-certificate-from-csr --certificate-signing-request file://my-csr-directory/{}

On Windows PowerShell, the command to create certificates for all CSRs in my-csr-directory is:

> ls -Name my-csr-directory | %{aws iot create-certificate-from-csr --certificate-signing-request file://my-csr-directory/$_}

On a Windows command prompt, the command to create certificates for all CSRs in my-csr-directory is:

> forfiles /p my-csr-directory /c "cmd /c aws iot create-certificate-from-csr --certificate-signing-request file://@path"

get.description: List the device certificates signed by the specified CA certificate.
Lists certificates that are being transferred but not yet accepted.

delete.description:
Deletes the specified certificate.

A certificate cannot be deleted if it has a policy attached to it or if its status is set to ACTIVE. To delete a certificate, first use the DetachPrincipalPolicy API to detach all policies. Next, use the UpdateCertificate API to set the certificate to the INACTIVE status.

get.description: Gets information about the specified certificate.

put.description:
Updates the status of the specified certificate. This operation is idempotent.

Moving a certificate from the ACTIVE state (including REVOKED) will not disconnect currently connected devices, but these devices will be unable to reconnect.

The ACTIVE state is required to authenticate devices connecting to AWS IoT using a certificate.

get.description: Describes the default authorizer.

post.description: Sets the default authorizer. This will be used if a websocket connection is made without specifying an authorizer.
Gets effective policies.

get.description: Returns a unique endpoint specific to the AWS account making the call.
Describes event configurations.
Gets the search configuration.

post.description: Updates the search configuration.

get.description: Lists the search indices.

post.description: The query search index.

get.description: Describes a search index.
Lists jobs.
Describes a job.
Gets a job document.

post.description:
Associates a group with a continuous job. The following criteria must be met:

  • The job must have been created with the targetSelection field set to "CONTINUOUS".

  • The job status must currently be "IN_PROGRESS".

  • The total number of targets associated with a job must not exceed 100.

get.description: Lists the job executions for a job.

post.description:
Creates a 2048-bit RSA key pair and issues an X.509 certificate using the issued public key.

Note This is the only time AWS IoT issues the private key for this certificate, so it is important to keep it in a secure location.

get.description: Gets the logging options.

post.description: Sets the logging options.

get.description: Lists OTA updates.
Gets an OTA update.

post.description: Creates an AWS IoT OTAUpdate on a target group of things or groups.

get.description: Lists your policies.

delete.description:
Deletes the specified policy.

A policy cannot be deleted if it has non-default versions or it is attached to any certificate.

To delete a policy, use the DeletePolicyVersion API to delete all non-default versions of the policy; use the DetachPrincipalPolicy API to detach the policy from any certificate; and then use the DeletePolicy API to delete the policy.

When a policy is deleted using DeletePolicy, its default version is deleted with it.

get.description: Gets information about the specified policy with the policy document of the default version.

post.description:
Creates an AWS IoT policy.

The created policy is the default version for the policy. This operation creates a policy version with a version identifier of 1 and sets 1 as the policy's default version.

get.description: Lists the versions of the specified policy and identifies the default version.

post.description:
Creates a new version of the specified AWS IoT policy. To update a policy, create a new policy version. A managed policy can have up to five versions. If the policy has five versions, you must use DeletePolicyVersion to delete an existing version before you create a new one.

Optionally, you can set the new version as the policy's default version. The default version is the operative version (that is, the version that is in effect for the certificates to which the policy is attached).

delete.description: Deletes the specified version of the specified policy. You cannot delete the default version of a policy using this API. To delete the default version of a policy, use DeletePolicy. To find out which version of a policy is marked as the default version, use ListPolicyVersions.

get.description: Gets information about the specified policy version.

patch.description: Sets the specified version of the specified policy as the policy's default (operative) version. This action affects all certificates to which the policy is attached. To list the principals the policy is attached to, use the ListPrincipalPolicy API.

get.description:
Lists the principals associated with the specified policy.

Note: This API is deprecated. Please use ListTargetsForPolicy instead.

post.description: List targets for the specified policy.

get.description:
Lists the policies attached to the specified principal. If you use an Cognito identity, the ID must be in AmazonCognito Identity format.

Note: This API is deprecated. Please use ListAttachedPolicies instead.

delete.description:
Removes the specified policy from the specified certificate.

Note: This API is deprecated. Please use DetachPolicy instead.

put.description:
Attaches the specified policy to the specified principal (certificate or other credential).

Note: This API is deprecated. Please use AttachPolicy instead.

get.description: Lists the things associated with the specified principal.

delete.description: Deletes a CA certificate registration code.

get.description: Gets a registration code used to register a CA certificate with AWS IoT.

patch.description:
Rejects a pending certificate transfer. After AWS IoT rejects a certificate transfer, the certificate status changes from PENDING_TRANSFER to INACTIVE.

To check for pending certificate transfers, call ListCertificates to enumerate your certificates.

This operation can only be called by the transfer destination. After it is called, the certificate will be returned to the source's account in the INACTIVE state.

get.description: Lists the role aliases registered in your account.
Describes a role alias.

post.description: Creates a role alias.

get.description: Lists the rules for the specific topic.
Gets information about the rule.

patch.description: Replaces the rule. You must specify all parameters for the new rule. Creating rules is an administrator-level action. Any user who has permission to create rules will be able to access data processed by the rule.

post.description: Creates a rule. Creating rules is an administrator-level action. Any user who has permission to create rules will be able to access data processed by the rule.
Disables the rule.
Enables the rule.

get.description: Lists all of the streams in your AWS account.
Gets information about a stream.

post.description: Creates a stream for delivering one or more large files in chunks over MQTT. A stream transports data bytes in chunks or blocks packaged as MQTT messages from a source like S3. You can have one or more files associated with a stream. The total size of a file associated with the stream cannot exceed more than 2 MB. The stream will be created with version 0. If a stream is created with the same streamID as a stream that existed and was deleted within last 90 days, we will resurrect that old stream by incrementing the version by 1.

put.description: Updates an existing stream. The stream version will be incremented by one.

post.description: Detaches a policy from the specified target.

put.description: Attaches a policy to the specified target.

post.description: Test custom authorization.

get.description: List the thing groups in your account.

put.description: Adds a thing to a thing group.
Remove the specified thing from the specified group.
Updates the groups to which the thing belongs.

get.description: Describe a thing group.

post.description: Create a thing group.

get.description: Lists the things in the specified group.
List bulk thing provisioning tasks.

post.description: Creates a bulk thing provisioning task.

get.description: Describes a bulk thing provisioning task.

put.description: Cancels a bulk thing provisioning task.

get.description: Information about the thing registration tasks.
Lists the existing thing types.

delete.description: Deletes the specified thing type . You cannot delete a thing type if it has things associated with it. To delete a thing type, first mark it as deprecated by calling DeprecateThingType, then remove any associated things by calling UpdateThing to change the thing type on any associated thing, and finally use DeleteThingType to delete the thing type.

get.description: Gets information about the specified thing type.

post.description: Creates a new thing type.
Deprecates a thing type. You can not associate new things with deprecated thing type.

get.description: Lists your things. Use the attributeName and attributeValue parameters to filter your things. For example, calling ListThings with attributeName=Color and attributeValue=Red retrieves all things in the registry that contain an attribute Color with the value Red.

post.description: Provisions a thing.

get.description: Gets information about the specified thing.

patch.description: Updates the data for a thing.

post.description: Creates a thing record in the thing registry.

get.description: Lists the job executions for the specified thing.
Describes a job execution.

delete.description: Detaches the specified principal from the specified thing.

get.description: Lists the principals associated with the specified thing.

put.description: Attaches the specified principal to the specified thing.

get.description: List the thing groups to which the specified thing belongs.

patch.description:
Transfers the specified certificate to the specified AWS account.

You can cancel the transfer until it is acknowledged by the recipient.

No notification is sent to the transfer destination's account. It is up to the caller to notify the transfer target.

The certificate being transferred must not be in the ACTIVE state. You can use the UpdateCertificate API to deactivate it.

The certificate must not have any policies attached to it. You can use the DetachPrincipalPolicy API to detach them.

get.description: Lists logging levels.

post.description: Sets the logging level.

get.description: Gets the fine grained logging options.

post.description: Sets the logging options for the V2 logging service.

AcceptCertificateTransferRequest.description: The input for the AcceptCertificateTransfer operation.

Action.description: Describes the actions associated with a rule.

cloudwatchAlarm.description: Change the state of a CloudWatch alarm.

dynamoDBv2.description: Write to a DynamoDB table. This is a new version of the DynamoDB action. It allows you to write each attribute in an MQTT message payload into a separate DynamoDB column.

elasticsearch.description: Write data to an Amazon Elasticsearch Service domain.

firehose.description: Write to an Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.

kinesis.description: Write data to an Amazon Kinesis stream.

s3.description: Write to an Amazon S3 bucket.

salesforce.description: Send a message to a Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream.

sns.description: Publish to an Amazon SNS topic.

sqs.description: Publish to an Amazon SQS queue.

thingArn.description: The ARN of the thing to add to a group.

thingGroupArn.description: The ARN of the group to which you are adding a thing.

thingGroupName.description: The name of the group to which you are adding a thing.

thingName.description: The name of the thing to add to a group.

Allowed.description: Contains information that allowed the authorization.

policies.description: A list of policies that allowed the authentication.

comment.description: An optional comment string describing why the job was associated with the targets.

targets.description: A list of thing group ARNs that define the targets of the job.

description.description: A short text description of the job.

jobId.description: The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.

target.description: The identity to which the policy is attached.

AttachPrincipalPolicyRequest.description: The input for the AttachPrincipalPolicy operation.

AttachThingPrincipalRequest.description: The input for the AttachThingPrincipal operation.

AttachThingPrincipalResponse.description: The output from the AttachThingPrincipal operation.

attributes.description:
A JSON string containing up to three key-value pair in JSON format. For example:

{\"attributes\":{\"string1\":\"string2\"}}

merge.description:
Specifies whether the list of attributes provided in the AttributePayload is merged with the attributes stored in the registry, instead of overwriting them.

To remove an attribute, call UpdateThing with an empty attribute value.

The merge attribute is only valid when calling UpdateThing.

actionType.description: The type of action for which the principal is being authorized.

resources.description: The resources for which the principal is being authorized to perform the specified action.

allowed.description: The policies and statements that allowed the specified action.

authDecision.description: The final authorization decision of this scenario. Multiple statements are taken into account when determining the authorization decision. An explicit deny statement can override multiple allow statements.

denied.description: The policies and statements that denied the specified action.

missingContextValues.description: Contains any missing context values found while evaluating policy.

creationDate.description: The UNIX timestamp of when the authorizer was created.

lastModifiedDate.description: The UNIX timestamp of when the authorizer was last updated.

tokenKeyName.description: The key used to extract the token from the HTTP headers.

tokenSigningPublicKeys.description: The public keys used to validate the token signature returned by your custom authentication service.

certificateArn.description: The ARN of the CA certificate.

certificateId.description: The ID of the CA certificate.

creationDate.description: The date the CA certificate was created.

status.description:
The status of the CA certificate.

The status value REGISTER_INACTIVE is deprecated and should not be used.

autoRegistrationStatus.description: Whether the CA certificate configured for auto registration of device certificates. Valid values are "ENABLE" and "DISABLE"

certificatePem.description: The CA certificate data, in PEM format.

creationDate.description: The date the CA certificate was created.

ownedBy.description: The owner of the CA certificate.

status.description: The status of a CA certificate.

CancelCertificateTransferRequest.description: The input for the CancelCertificateTransfer operation.

comment.description: An optional comment string describing why the job was canceled.

description.description: A short text description of the job.

jobId.description: The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.

creationDate.description: The date and time the certificate was created.

status.description:
The status of the certificate.

The status value REGISTER_INACTIVE is deprecated and should not be used.

CertificateConflictException.description: Unable to verify the CA certificate used to sign the device certificate you are attempting to register. This is happens when you have registered more than one CA certificate that has the same subject field and public key.

caCertificateId.description: The certificate ID of the CA certificate used to sign this certificate.

certificatePem.description: The certificate data, in PEM format.

creationDate.description: The date and time the certificate was created.

lastModifiedDate.description: The date and time the certificate was last modified.

ownedBy.description: The ID of the AWS account that owns the certificate.

previousOwnedBy.description: The ID of the AWS account of the previous owner of the certificate.

CertificateStateException.description: The certificate operation is not allowed.

CloudwatchAlarmAction.description: Describes an action that updates a CloudWatch alarm.

roleArn.description: The IAM role that allows access to the CloudWatch alarm.

stateReason.description: The reason for the alarm change.

stateValue.description: The value of the alarm state. Acceptable values are: OK, ALARM, INSUFFICIENT_DATA.

CloudwatchMetricAction.description: Describes an action that captures a CloudWatch metric.

roleArn.description: The IAM role that allows access to the CloudWatch metric.

CodeSigning.description: Describes the method to use when code signing a file.

awsSignerJobId.description: The ID of the AWSSignerJob which was created to sign the file.

customCodeSigning.description: A custom method for code signing a file.

CodeSigningCertificateChain.description: Describes the certificate chain being used when code signing a file.

inlineDocument.description: A base64 encoded binary representation of the code signing certificate chain.

stream.description: A stream of the certificate chain files.

CodeSigningSignature.description: Describes the signature for a file.

inlineDocument.description: A base64 encoded binary representation of the code signing signature.

stream.description: A stream of the code signing signature.

ConflictingResourceUpdateException.description: A conflicting resource update exception. This exception is thrown when two pending updates cause a conflict.

authorizerFunctionArn.description: The ARN of the authorizer's Lambda function.

status.description: The status of the create authorizer request.

tokenKeyName.description: The name of the token key used to extract the token from the HTTP headers.

tokenSigningPublicKeys.description: The public keys used to verify the digital signature returned by your custom authentication service.

CreateCertificateFromCsrRequest.description: The input for the CreateCertificateFromCsr operation.

CreateCertificateFromCsrResponse.description: The output from the CreateCertificateFromCsr operation.

certificateArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate. You can use the ARN as a principal for policy operations.

certificateId.description: The ID of the certificate. Certificate management operations only take a certificateId.

certificatePem.description: The certificate data, in PEM format.

description.description: A short text description of the job.

documentSource.description: An S3 link to the job document.

jobExecutionsRolloutConfig.description: Allows you to create a staged rollout of the job.

presignedUrlConfig.description: Configuration information for pre-signed S3 URLs.

targetSelection.description: Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on a thing when the thing is added to a target group, even after the job was completed by all things originally in the group.

targets.description: A list of things and thing groups to which the job should be sent.

jobId.description: The unique identifier you assigned to this job.

CreateKeysAndCertificateRequest.description: The input for the CreateKeysAndCertificate operation.

CreateKeysAndCertificateResponse.description: The output of the CreateKeysAndCertificate operation.

certificateId.description: The ID of the certificate. AWS IoT issues a default subject name for the certificate (for example, AWS IoT Certificate).

certificatePem.description: The certificate data, in PEM format.

additionalParameters.description: A list of additional OTA update parameters which are name-value pairs.

description.description: The description of the OTA update.

files.description: The files to be streamed by the OTA update.

roleArn.description: The IAM role that allows access to the AWS IoT Jobs service.

targetSelection.description: Specifies whether the update will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will be complete after all the things specified as targets have completed the update (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the update may also be run on a thing when a change is detected in a target. For example, an update will run on a thing when the thing is added to a target group, even after the update was completed by all things originally in the group. Valid values: CONTINUOUS | SNAPSHOT.

targets.description: The targeted devices to receive OTA updates.

awsIotJobArn.description: The AWS IoT job ARN associated with the OTA update.

awsIotJobId.description: The AWS IoT job ID associated with the OTA update.

CreatePolicyRequest.description: The input for the CreatePolicy operation.

policyDocument.description: The JSON document that describes the policy. policyDocument must have a minimum length of 1, with a maximum length of 2048, excluding whitespace.

CreatePolicyResponse.description: The output from the CreatePolicy operation.

policyDocument.description: The JSON document that describes the policy.

CreatePolicyVersionRequest.description: The input for the CreatePolicyVersion operation.

policyDocument.description: The JSON document that describes the policy. Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 2048, excluding whitespace.

CreatePolicyVersionResponse.description: The output of the CreatePolicyVersion operation.

isDefaultVersion.description: Specifies whether the policy version is the default.

policyDocument.description: The JSON document that describes the policy.

credentialDurationSeconds.description: How long (in seconds) the credentials will be valid.

roleArn.description: The role ARN.
An IAM role that allows the IoT service principal assumes to access your S3 files.

parentGroupName.description: The name of the parent thing group.

CreateThingRequest.description: The input for the CreateThing operation.

attributePayload.description:
The attribute payload, which consists of up to three name/value pairs in a JSON document. For example:

{\"attributes\":{\"string1\":\"string2\"}}

thingTypeName.description: The name of the thing type associated with the new thing.

thingArn.description: The ARN of the new thing.

thingName.description: The name of the new thing.

thingTypeArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the thing type.

thingTypeName.description: The name of the thing type.

CreateTopicRuleRequest.description: The input for the CreateTopicRule operation.

CustomCodeSigning.description: Describes a custom method used to code sign a file.

hashAlgorithm.description: The hash algorithm used to code sign the file.

signatureAlgorithm.description: The signature algorithm used to code sign the file.

DeleteCACertificateResponse.description: The output for the DeleteCACertificate operation.

DeleteCertificateRequest.description: The input for the DeleteCertificate operation.

DeleteConflictException.description: You can't delete the resource because it is attached to one or more resources.

DeletePolicyRequest.description: The input for the DeletePolicy operation.

DeletePolicyVersionRequest.description: The input for the DeletePolicyVersion operation.

DeleteRegistrationCodeRequest.description: The input for the DeleteRegistrationCode operation.

DeleteRegistrationCodeResponse.description: The output for the DeleteRegistrationCode operation.

DeleteThingRequest.description: The input for the DeleteThing operation.

DeleteThingResponse.description: The output of the DeleteThing operation.

DeleteThingTypeRequest.description: The input for the DeleteThingType operation.

DeleteThingTypeResponse.description: The output for the DeleteThingType operation.

DeleteTopicRuleRequest.description: The input for the DeleteTopicRule operation.

Denied.description: Contains information that denied the authorization.

explicitDeny.description: Information that explicitly denies the authorization.

implicitDeny.description: Information that implicitly denies the authorization. When a policy doesn't explicitly deny or allow an action on a resource it is considered an implicit deny.

DeprecateThingTypeRequest.description: The input for the DeprecateThingType operation.

undoDeprecate.description: Whether to undeprecate a deprecated thing type. If true, the thing type will not be deprecated anymore and you can associate it with things.

DeprecateThingTypeResponse.description: The output for the DeprecateThingType operation.

DescribeCACertificateRequest.description: The input for the DescribeCACertificate operation.

DescribeCACertificateResponse.description: The output from the DescribeCACertificate operation.

DescribeCertificateRequest.description: The input for the DescribeCertificate operation.

DescribeCertificateResponse.description: The output of the DescribeCertificate operation.

DescribeEndpointRequest.description: The input for the DescribeEndpoint operation.

DescribeEndpointResponse.description: The output from the DescribeEndpoint operation.

endpointAddress.description: The endpoint. The format of the endpoint is as follows: identifier.iot.region.amazonaws.com.

creationDate.description: The creation date of the event configuration.

lastModifiedDate.description: The date the event configurations were last modified.

schema.description:
Contains a value that specifies the type of indexing performed. Valid values are:

  1. REGISTRY Your thing index will contain only registry data.

  2. REGISTRY_AND_SHADOW - Your thing index will contain registry and shadow data.

documentSource.description: An S3 link to the job document.

thingGroupName.description: The name of the thing group.

version.description: The version of the thing group.

failureCount.description: The number of things that failed to be provisioned.

inputFileBucket.description: The S3 bucket that contains the input file.

lastModifiedDate.description: The date when the task was last modified.

percentageProgress.description: The progress of the bulk provisioning task expressed as a percentage.

roleArn.description: The role ARN that grants access to the input file bucket.

status.description: The status of the bulk thing provisioning task.

successCount.description: The number of things successfully provisioned.

DescribeThingRequest.description: The input for the DescribeThing operation.

DescribeThingResponse.description: The output from the DescribeThing operation.

thingArn.description: The ARN of the thing to describe.

thingId.description: The ID of the thing to describe.

version.description:
The current version of the thing record in the registry.

To avoid unintentional changes to the information in the registry, you can pass the version information in the expectedVersion parameter of the UpdateThing and DeleteThing calls.

DescribeThingTypeRequest.description: The input for the DescribeThingType operation.

DescribeThingTypeResponse.description: The output for the DescribeThingType operation.

thingTypeMetadata.description: The ThingTypeMetadata contains additional information about the thing type including: creation date and time, a value indicating whether the thing type is deprecated, and a date and time when it was deprecated.

thingTypeName.description: The name of the thing type.

thingTypeProperties.description: The ThingTypeProperties contains information about the thing type including description, and a list of searchable thing attribute names.

target.description: The target from which the policy will be detached.

DetachPrincipalPolicyRequest.description: The input for the DetachPrincipalPolicy operation.

DetachThingPrincipalRequest.description: The input for the DetachThingPrincipal operation.

DetachThingPrincipalResponse.description: The output from the DetachThingPrincipal operation.

DisableTopicRuleRequest.description: The input for the DisableTopicRuleRequest operation.

DynamoDBAction.description:
Describes an action to write to a DynamoDB table.

The tableName, hashKeyField, and rangeKeyField values must match the values used when you created the table.

The hashKeyValue and rangeKeyvalue fields use a substitution template syntax. These templates provide data at runtime. The syntax is as follows: ${sql-expression}.

You can specify any valid expression in a WHERE or SELECT clause, including JSON properties, comparisons, calculations, and functions. For example, the following field uses the third level of the topic:

"hashKeyValue": "${topic(3)}"

The following field uses the timestamp:

"rangeKeyValue": "${timestamp()}"

hashKeyType.description: The hash key type. Valid values are "STRING" or "NUMBER"

operation.description: The type of operation to be performed. This follows the substitution template, so it can be ${operation}, but the substitution must result in one of the following: INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE.

payloadField.description: The action payload. This name can be customized.

rangeKeyType.description: The range key type. Valid values are "STRING" or "NUMBER"

roleArn.description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.

tableName.description: The name of the DynamoDB table.

DynamoDBv2Action.description:
Describes an action to write to a DynamoDB table.

This DynamoDB action writes each attribute in the message payload into it's own column in the DynamoDB table.

putItem.description:
Specifies the DynamoDB table to which the message data will be written. For example:

{ "dynamoDBv2": { "roleArn": "aws:iam:12341251:my-role" "putItem": { "tableName": "my-table" } } }

Each attribute in the message payload will be written to a separate column in the DynamoDB database.

roleArn.description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access to the DynamoDB table.

EffectivePolicy.description: The policy that has the effect on the authorization results.

ElasticsearchAction.description: Describes an action that writes data to an Amazon Elasticsearch Service domain.

endpoint.description: The endpoint of your Elasticsearch domain.

id.description: The unique identifier for the document you are storing.

index.description: The Elasticsearch index where you want to store your data.

roleArn.description: The IAM role ARN that has access to Elasticsearch.

type.description: The type of document you are storing.

EnableTopicRuleRequest.description: The input for the EnableTopicRuleRequest operation.

policies.description: The policies that denied the authorization.

FirehoseAction.description: Describes an action that writes data to an Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.

roleArn.description: The IAM role that grants access to the Amazon Kinesis Firehose stream.

separator.description: A character separator that will be used to separate records written to the Firehose stream. Valid values are: '\n' (newline), '\t' (tab), '\r\n' (Windows newline), ',' (comma).

GetLoggingOptionsRequest.description: The input for the GetLoggingOptions operation.

GetLoggingOptionsResponse.description: The output from the GetLoggingOptions operation.

roleArn.description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.

GetPolicyRequest.description: The input for the GetPolicy operation.

GetPolicyResponse.description: The output from the GetPolicy operation.

policyDocument.description: The JSON document that describes the policy.

GetPolicyVersionRequest.description: The input for the GetPolicyVersion operation.

GetPolicyVersionResponse.description: The output from the GetPolicyVersion operation.

isDefaultVersion.description: Specifies whether the policy version is the default.

policyDocument.description: The JSON document that describes the policy.

GetRegistrationCodeRequest.description: The input to the GetRegistrationCode operation.

GetRegistrationCodeResponse.description: The output from the GetRegistrationCode operation.

GetTopicRuleRequest.description: The input for the GetTopicRule operation.

GetTopicRuleResponse.description: The output from the GetTopicRule operation.

roleArn.description: The IAM role ARN AWS IoT uses to write to your CloudWatch logs.

GroupNameAndArn.description: The name and ARN of a group.

ImplicitDeny.description: Information that implicitly denies authorization. When policy doesn't explicitly deny or allow an action on a resource it is considered an implicit deny.

policies.description: Policies that don't contain a matching allow or deny statement for the specified action on the specified resource.

Job.description: The Job object contains details about a job.

comment.description: If the job was updated, describes the reason for the update.

completedAt.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the job was completed.

createdAt.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the job was created.

description.description: A short text description of the job.

documentParameters.description: The parameters specified for the job document.

jobArn.description: An ARN identifying the job with format "arn:aws:iot:region:account:job/jobId".

jobExecutionsRolloutConfig.description: Allows you to create a staged rollout of a job.

jobId.description: The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.

lastUpdatedAt.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the job was last updated.

status.description: The status of the job, one of IN_PROGRESS, CANCELED, or COMPLETED.

targetSelection.description: Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on a device when the thing representing the device is added to a target group, even after the job was completed by all things originally in the group.

targets.description: A list of IoT things and thing groups to which the job should be sent.

JobExecution.description: The job execution object represents the execution of a job on a particular device.

executionNumber.description: A string (consisting of the digits "0" through "9") which identifies this particular job execution on this particular device. It can be used in commands which return or update job execution information.

jobId.description: The unique identifier you assigned to the job when it was created.

lastUpdatedAt.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the job execution was last updated.

queuedAt.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the job execution was queued.

startedAt.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the job execution started.

status.description: The status of the job execution (IN_PROGRESS, QUEUED, FAILED, SUCCESS, CANCELED, or REJECTED).

statusDetails.description: A collection of name/value pairs that describe the status of the job execution.

thingArn.description: The ARN of the thing on which the job execution is running.

JobExecutionStatusDetails.description: Details of the job execution status.

executionNumber.description: A string (consisting of the digits "0" through "9") which identifies this particular job execution on this particular device. It can be used later in commands which return or update job execution information.

lastUpdatedAt.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the job execution was last updated.

queuedAt.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the job execution was queued.

startedAt.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the job execution started.

status.description: The status of the job execution.

JobExecutionSummaryForJob.description: Contains a summary of information about job executions for a specific job.

jobExecutionSummary.description: Contains a subset of information about a job execution.

thingArn.description: The ARN of the thing on which the job execution is running.

JobExecutionSummaryForThing.description: The job execution summary for a thing.

jobExecutionSummary.description: Contains a subset of information about a job execution.

jobId.description: The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.

JobExecutionsRolloutConfig.description: Allows you to create a staged rollout of a job.

maximumPerMinute.description: The maximum number of things that will be notified of a pending job, per minute. This parameter allows you to create a staged rollout.

numberOfCanceledThings.description: The number of things that cancelled the job.

numberOfFailedThings.description: The number of things that failed executing the job.

numberOfInProgressThings.description: The number of things currently executing the job.

numberOfQueuedThings.description: The number of things that are awaiting execution of the job.

numberOfRejectedThings.description: The number of things that rejected the job.

numberOfRemovedThings.description: The number of things that are no longer scheduled to execute the job because they have been deleted or have been removed from the group that was a target of the job.

numberOfSucceededThings.description: The number of things which successfully completed the job.

processingTargets.description: The devices on which the job is executing.

completedAt.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the job completed.

createdAt.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the job was created.

jobId.description: The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.

lastUpdatedAt.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the job was last updated.

targetSelection.description: Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on a thing when the thing is added to a target group, even after the job was completed by all things originally in the group.

thingGroupId.description: The ID of the thing group.

OTAUpdateFile.description: Describes a file to be associated with an OTA update.

codeSigning.description: The code signing method of the file.

awsIotJobArn.description: The AWS IoT job ARN associated with the OTA update.

awsIotJobId.description: The AWS IoT job ID associated with the OTA update.

creationDate.description: The date when the OTA update was created.

description.description: A description of the OTA update.

errorInfo.description: Error information associated with the OTA update.

lastModifiedDate.description: The date when the OTA update was last updated.

otaUpdateFiles.description: A list of files associated with the OTA update.

otaUpdateStatus.description: The status of the OTA update.

targetSelection.description: Specifies whether the OTA update will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed the OTA update (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the OTA update may also be run on a thing when a change is detected in a target. For example, an OTA update will run on a thing when the thing is added to a target group, even after the OTA update was completed by all things originally in the group.

targets.description: The targets of the OTA update.

creationDate.description: The date when the OTA update was created.

OutgoingCertificate.description: A certificate that has been transferred but not yet accepted.

transferDate.description: The date the transfer was initiated.

transferredTo.description: The AWS account to which the transfer was made.

createDate.description: The date and time the policy was created.

isDefaultVersion.description: Specifies whether the policy version is the default.

expiresInSec.description: How long (in seconds) pre-signed URLs are valid. Valid values are 60 - 3600, the default value is 3600 seconds. Pre-signed URLs are generated when Jobs receives an MQTT request for the job document.

roleArn.description: The ARN of an IAM role that grants grants permission to download files from the S3 bucket where the job data/updates are stored. The role must also grant permission for IoT to download the files.

PutItemInput.description: The input for the DynamoActionVS action that specifies the DynamoDB table to which the message data will be written.

tableName.description: The table where the message data will be written

caCertificatePem.description: The CA certificate used to sign the device certificate being registered.

certificatePem.description: The certificate data, in PEM format.

status.description: The status of the register certificate request.

RegisterCertificateResponse.description: The output from the RegisterCertificate operation.

parameters.description: The parameters for provisioning a thing.

roleArn.description: The ARN of the role.

RejectCertificateTransferRequest.description: The input for the RejectCertificateTransfer operation.

rejectReason.description: The reason the certificate transfer was rejected.

thingArn.description: The ARN of the thing to remove from the group.

thingName.description: The name of the thing to remove from the group.

ReplaceTopicRuleRequest.description: The input for the ReplaceTopicRule operation.

RepublishAction.description: Describes an action to republish to another topic.

roleArn.description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.

topic.description: The name of the MQTT topic.

resourceArn.description: The ARN of the resource that caused the exception.

resourceId.description: The ID of the resource that caused the exception.

ResourceNotFoundException.description: The specified resource does not exist.

creationDate.description: The UNIX timestamp of when the role alias was created.

credentialDurationSeconds.description: The number of seconds for which the credential is valid.

lastModifiedDate.description: The UNIX timestamp of when the role alias was last modified.

roleArn.description: The role ARN.

S3Action.description: Describes an action to write data to an Amazon S3 bucket.

cannedAcl.description: The Amazon S3 canned ACL that controls access to the object identified by the object key. For more information, see S3 canned ACLs.

roleArn.description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.

S3Location.description: The location in S3 the contains the files to stream.

bucket.description: The S3 bucket that contains the file to stream.

key.description: The name of the file within the S3 bucket to stream.

SalesforceAction.description: Describes an action to write a message to a Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream.

token.description: The token used to authenticate access to the Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream. The token is available from the Salesforce IoT Cloud platform after creation of the Input Stream.

url.description: The URL exposed by the Salesforce IoT Cloud Input Stream. The URL is available from the Salesforce IoT Cloud platform after creation of the Input Stream.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of results to return at one time.

nextToken.description: The token used to get the next set of results, or null if there are no additional results.
The token used to get the next set of results, or null if there are no additional results.

things.description: The things that match the search query.

SetDefaultPolicyVersionRequest.description: The input for the SetDefaultPolicyVersion operation.

SetLoggingOptionsRequest.description: The input for the SetLoggingOptions operation.

disableAllLogs.description: Set to true to disable all logs, otherwise set to false.

roleArn.description: The role ARN that allows IoT to write to Cloudwatch logs.

SnsAction.description: Describes an action to publish to an Amazon SNS topic.

messageFormat.description: The message format of the message to publish. Optional. Accepted values are "JSON" and "RAW". The default value of the attribute is "RAW". SNS uses this setting to determine if the payload should be parsed and relevant platform-specific bits of the payload should be extracted. To read more about SNS message formats, see http://docs.aws.amazon.com/sns/latest/dg/json-formats.html refer to their official documentation.

roleArn.description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.

targetArn.description: The ARN of the SNS topic.

SqlParseException.description: The Rule-SQL expression can't be parsed correctly.

SqsAction.description: Describes an action to publish data to an Amazon SQS queue.

queueUrl.description: The URL of the Amazon SQS queue.

roleArn.description: The ARN of the IAM role that grants access.

useBase64.description: Specifies whether to use Base64 encoding.

inputFileBucket.description: The S3 bucket that contains the input file.

inputFileKey.description: The name of input file within the S3 bucket. This file contains a newline delimited JSON file. Each line contains the parameter values to provision one device (thing).

roleArn.description: The IAM role ARN that grants permission the input file.

taskId.description: The bulk thing provisioning task ID.

Stream.description: Describes a group of files that can be streamed.

fileId.description: The ID of a file associated with a stream.

s3Location.description: The location of the file in S3.

createdAt.description: The date when the stream was created.

lastUpdatedAt.description: The date when the stream was last updated.

roleArn.description: An IAM role AWS IoT assumes to access your S3 files.

authInfos.description: A list of authorization info objects. Simulating authorization will create a response for each authInfo object in the list.

policyNamesToAdd.description: When testing custom authorization, the policies specified here are treated as if they are attached to the principal being authorized.

policyNamesToSkip.description: When testing custom authorization, the policies specified here are treated as if they are not attached to the principal being authorized.

token.description: The token returned by your custom authentication service.

tokenSignature.description: The signature made with the token and your custom authentication service's private key.

disconnectAfterInSeconds.description: The number of seconds after which the connection is terminated.

isAuthenticated.description: True if the token is authenticated, otherwise false.

refreshAfterInSeconds.description: The number of seconds after which the temporary credentials are refreshed.

ThingAttribute.description: The properties of the thing, including thing name, thing type name, and a list of thing attributes.

attributes.description: A list of thing attributes which are name-value pairs.

thingTypeName.description: The name of the thing type, if the thing has been associated with a type.

version.description: The version of the thing record in the registry.

creationDate.description: The UNIX timestamp of when the thing group was created.

attributePayload.description: The thing group attributes in JSON format.

thingIndexingMode.description:
Thing indexing mode. Valid values are:

  • REGISTRY Your thing index will contain only registry data.

  • REGISTRY_AND_SHADOW - Your thing index will contain registry and shadow data.

  • OFF - Thing indexing is disabled.

ThingTypeDefinition.description: The definition of the thing type, including thing type name and description.

thingTypeMetadata.description: The ThingTypeMetadata contains additional information about the thing type including: creation date and time, a value indicating whether the thing type is deprecated, and a date and time when it was deprecated.

thingTypeName.description: The name of the thing type.

thingTypeProperties.description: The ThingTypeProperties for the thing type.

ThingTypeMetadata.description: The ThingTypeMetadata contains additional information about the thing type including: creation date and time, a value indicating whether the thing type is deprecated, and a date and time when time was deprecated.

creationDate.description: The date and time when the thing type was created.

deprecationDate.description: The date and time when the thing type was deprecated.

ThingTypeProperties.description: The ThingTypeProperties contains information about the thing type including: a thing type description, and a list of searchable thing attribute names.

searchableAttributes.description: A list of searchable thing attribute names.

thingTypeDescription.description: The description of the thing type.

actions.description: The actions associated with the rule.

awsIotSqlVersion.description: The version of the SQL rules engine to use when evaluating the rule.

createdAt.description: The date and time the rule was created.

errorAction.description: The action to perform when an error occurs.

ruleDisabled.description: Specifies whether the rule is disabled.

sql.description: The SQL statement used to query the topic. When using a SQL query with multiple lines, be sure to escape the newline characters.

createdAt.description: The date and time the rule was created.

ruleDisabled.description: Specifies whether the rule is disabled.

topicPattern.description: The pattern for the topic names that apply.

actions.description: The actions associated with the rule.

awsIotSqlVersion.description: The version of the SQL rules engine to use when evaluating the rule.

errorAction.description: The action to take when an error occurs.

ruleDisabled.description: Specifies whether the rule is disabled.

sql.description: The SQL statement used to query the topic. For more information, see AWS IoT SQL Reference in the AWS IoT Developer Guide.

TransferAlreadyCompletedException.description: You can't revert the certificate transfer because the transfer is already complete.

TransferCertificateRequest.description: The input for the TransferCertificate operation.

TransferCertificateResponse.description: The output from the TransferCertificate operation.

TransferConflictException.description: You can't transfer the certificate because authorization policies are still attached.

TransferData.description: Data used to transfer a certificate to an AWS account.

acceptDate.description: The date the transfer was accepted.

rejectDate.description: The date the transfer was rejected.

rejectReason.description: The reason why the transfer was rejected.

transferDate.description: The date the transfer took place.

UnauthorizedException.description: You are not authorized to perform this operation.

authorizerFunctionArn.description: The ARN of the authorizer's Lambda function.

status.description: The status of the update authorizer request.

tokenKeyName.description: The key used to extract the token from the HTTP headers.

tokenSigningPublicKeys.description: The public keys used to verify the token signature.

UpdateCACertificateRequest.description: The input to the UpdateCACertificate operation.

UpdateCertificateRequest.description: The input for the UpdateCertificate operation.

credentialDurationSeconds.description: The number of seconds the credential will be valid.

roleArn.description: The role ARN.

files.description: The files associated with the stream.

roleArn.description: An IAM role that allows the IoT service principal assumes to access your S3 files.

expectedVersion.description: The expected version of the thing group. If this does not match the version of the thing group being updated, the update will fail.

version.description: The version of the updated thing group.

thingGroupsToAdd.description: The groups to which the thing will be added.

thingGroupsToRemove.description: The groups from which the thing will be removed.

thingName.description: The thing whose group memberships will be updated.

UpdateThingRequest.description: The input for the UpdateThing operation.

attributePayload.description:
A list of thing attributes, a JSON string containing name-value pairs. For example:

{\"attributes\":{\"name1\":\"value2\"}}

This data is used to add new attributes or update existing attributes.

expectedVersion.description: The expected version of the thing record in the registry. If the version of the record in the registry does not match the expected version specified in the request, the UpdateThing request is rejected with a VersionConflictException.

removeThingType.description: Remove a thing type association. If true, the association is removed.

thingTypeName.description: The name of the thing type.

UpdateThingResponse.description: The output from the UpdateThing operation.

VersionConflictException.description: An exception thrown when the version of a thing passed to a command is different than the version specified with the --version parameter.

VersionsLimitExceededException.description: The number of policy versions exceeds the limit.
